addressleaf.section:
To
e right honorable my very singular good Lord
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

11 July
1594
M
r
Bodley to my L.
From the Haghe.
lyklood
t
Gron
y
gh
e
will be rendred

page.lettertext:
fol.23r
May it please yo[r good L. since
e writing of my
former, we have l
re
s from
e campe,
at
e next day
after
e taking of
e Ravelin, those of Groeninghen
sent a messenger, to request of
Co. Maurice
to summon
them againe, and
at then they had resolved to capitulat
w
t
him w
t
out further delay. But he would not condesc
e
d
to summon them againe: so muche onely was obtained
at if they sent their ho stages p
nt
ly, they should be ad-
mitted, and
at
e states upon their comming would
also send their Deputies, to treate w
t
e towne. This
answear being given
e messenger returned, and w
at
hath folowed upon it, we are not yet advertised: but
by all kinde of likelihoode, they will not stand upon
e summons, nor they will not refuse any reasonable
conditions, suche as I am certaine will be offered unto
them, so
at we make full account,
at
e towne will be
surrendred in fower or five daies.
From
e Hage.
July 11 1594.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
